Subjective: Incredibly tired x2 months. Tired all day, sleeps a lot but wakes up tired. Sleep: superficial sometimes. Work: not called in sick, but considered; very tired at end of day, does nothing. Weekends: resting, hanging out. Exercise (climbing 2-3x/week, cycling): possible, no lack of muscle power. Associated: Muscle pain > usual, back pain > usual, morning stiffness. Negatives: No clear cause, no acute onset, no specific joint pain (hands/feet), no snoring, no new startling awake (lifelong, ~1x/week), no other respiratory problems (hay fever controlled with meds), no unusual palpitations, no chest pain, normal appetite/eating, stable weight (72kg), normal stools (daily, 3-4x/day, smooth), normal urination. ICE: Unsure if something wrong, concerned about rheumatism. Request: Wants blood tests.
Objective: Vitals: BP 110/60, HR 40-60 bpm (athletic). Heart: Sounds perfectly fine. Lungs: Clear to auscultation. Back: Pain on palpation lower back, next to center. No pain on pelvic compression. Long back muscles: supple, no L/R difference. Neck: Full ROM, no pain. Shoulders: Free. Abdomen: Lively peristalsis, normal percussion, supple on palpation, slightly uncomfortable but no sharp pain. General: No gross abnormalities.
Assessment: Chronic fatigue, etiology unclear. Myalgia, back pain, morning stiffness. Ruled out: Significant cardiac/pulmonary pathology, rheumatoid arthritis (based on history/exam).
Plan: 1. Explanation: No gross abnormalities on exam, but fatigue etiology unclear. 2. Labs: CBC (anemia), TSH (thyroid), ESR/CRP (inflammation). 3. Follow-up: Call day after blood test for results; phone appointment to discuss findings.
